name: Big Rude Jake
description:
'''Andrew Jacob Hiebert''' (1 March 1963 â€“ 16 June 2022), known professionally as '''Big Rude Jake''', was a Canadian songwriter, singer, musician, and bandleader based in [[Toronto]]. The original "Swing Punk", he was associated with the [[swing revival|neo-swing]] trend of the 1990s. Jake was drawn to the roots of American music, and incorporated elements of [[jazz]], blues, gospel, jump, and [[rockabilly]], among others. His [[Fingerstyle guitar|finger picking]] [[ragtime]] guitar style was inspired by the likes of Mose Scarlet and [[Leon Redbone]].

Jake stepped away from recording and touring for several years, during which time he began practicing [[Zen Buddhism]]. He returned in 2009 with a new album, Quicksand. He started touring Canada and Europe again in 2010, as well as playing in the United States.
